values.description:
This PR adds a curl request to local cloudsim-sim server after the docker build command. 

As part of this PR it was also fixed the issue of hg not being automatically updated when the instance was launched. 
In addition I had to update the cloudsim_deploy.bash script to also use ubuntu user when pulling from bitbucket.

@iche033 or @chapulina could you ptal ?

BTW, there is a new FC AMI : 

```
#!python


name: src-fc-0.1.11

id: ami-09efce69

```
values.title: Send event to portal notifying fc docker image was build

values.description:
Added support for wrapping all events within a parent property. Example: {"simulator": { event obj } } instead of just sending { event obj } .  This helps differentiating at Portal the events sent by the simulators vs those sent by the field computer.

In addition: when using this new parent property I had to keep track of and extend the cumulative state with the new event (before sending to portal). This was needed because the portal will just override everything with the received data, losing any data not included in the last event.

By doing this, in the srcsimulations resource @ portal , we will end up having something like:


```
#!python

srcsimulations-123: 
{
  fieldcomputer: { state derived from events sent by field comp},
  simulator: { state derived  from events sent by simulator},
  other data sent by other clients (which didn't go through events module)
}
```
values.title: Changes events:

summary.raw:
Added support for wrapping all events within a parent property. Example: {"simulator": { event obj } } instead of just sending { event obj } .  This helps differentiating at Portal the events sent by the simulators vs those sent by the field computer.

In addition: when using this new parent property I had to keep track of and extend the cumulative state with the new event (before sending to portal). This was needed because the portal will just override everything with the received data, losing any data not included in the last event.

By doing this, in the srcsimulations resource @ portal , we will end up having something like:


```
#!python

srcsimulations-123: 
{
  fieldcomputer: { state derived from events sent by field comp},
  simulator: { state derived  from events sent by simulator},
  other data sent by other clients (which didn't go through events module)
}
```
summary.html:
Added support for wrapping all events within a parent property. Example: {"simulator": { event obj } } instead of just sending { event obj } . This helps differentiating at Portal the events sent by the simulators vs those sent by the field computer.

In addition: when using this new parent property I had to keep track of and extend the cumulative state with the new event (before sending to portal). This was needed because the portal will just override everything with the received data, losing any data not included in the last event.

By doing this, in the srcsimulations resource @ portal , we will end up having something like:

srcsimulations-123: 
{
  fieldcomputer: { state derived from events sent by field comp},
  simulator: { state derived  from events sent by simulator},
  other data sent by other clients (which didn't go through events module)
}

values.title: Fix codeship tests

values.description:
Note: it'll not be automatically started. I added an arg to `fc_run_team_docker.bash` to start traffic shaper. 

Testing is a bit more involved:

1. launch simulator and FC (use AMI `src-fc-0.1.12a: ami-8f2909ef` for FC)
1. In FC instance, update cloudsim-sim to `fc_tc` branch and comment out the `if` check in `fc_run_team_docker.bash` to always start `src_monitor.bash` on FC
1. Press `>1` on sim instance to launch simulation. Wait for robot to be ready. You should see `Done` in `~/code/cloudsim-docker.log`
1. attach to sim docker instance and start the task: `rosservice call /srcsim/finals/start_task 1 1`
1. in sim docker instance, move the robot to checkpoint1: `gz model -m valkyrie -x 2.0 -y 0 -z 1.1 -R 0 -P 0 -Y 0`
1. verify messages are published to task topic: `rostopic echo /srcsim/finals/task`. If that doesn't happen, something is probably wrong in the init process. You'll need to stop the container and repeat from step 3
1. press `START` on FC instance, this should trigger traffic shaper
1. Launch VPN on OCU and test bandwidth to FC. e.g. `iperf -s` on OCU and `iperf -c 192.168.2.150` on FC to test downlink bandwidth
values.title: Integrate traffic shaper script

summary.raw:
Note: it'll not be automatically started. I added an arg to `fc_run_team_docker.bash` to start traffic shaper. 

Testing is a bit more involved:

1. launch simulator and FC (use AMI `src-fc-0.1.12a: ami-8f2909ef` for FC)
1. In FC instance, update cloudsim-sim to `fc_tc` branch and comment out the `if` check in `fc_run_team_docker.bash` to always start `src_monitor.bash` on FC
1. Press `>1` on sim instance to launch simulation. Wait for robot to be ready. You should see `Done` in `~/code/cloudsim-docker.log`
1. attach to sim docker instance and start the task: `rosservice call /srcsim/finals/start_task 1 1`
1. in sim docker instance, move the robot to checkpoint1: `gz model -m valkyrie -x 2.0 -y 0 -z 1.1 -R 0 -P 0 -Y 0`
1. verify messages are published to task topic: `rostopic echo /srcsim/finals/task`. If that doesn't happen, something is probably wrong in the init process. You'll need to stop the container and repeat from step 3
1. press `START` on FC instance, this should trigger traffic shaper
1. Launch VPN on OCU and test bandwidth to FC. e.g. `iperf -s` on OCU and `iperf -c 192.168.2.150` on FC to test downlink bandwidth
summary.html:
Note: it'll not be automatically started. I added an arg to fc_run_team_docker.bash to start traffic shaper.

Testing is a bit more involved:

  1. launch simulator and FC (use AMI src-fc-0.1.12a: ami-8f2909ef for FC)
  2. In FC instance, update cloudsim-sim to fc_tc branch and comment out the if check in fc_run_team_docker.bash to always start src_monitor.bash on FC
  3. Press >1 on sim instance to launch simulation. Wait for robot to be ready. You should see Done in ~/code/cloudsim-docker.log
  4. attach to sim docker instance and start the task: rosservice call /srcsim/finals/start_task 1 1
  5. in sim docker instance, move the robot to checkpoint1: gz model -m valkyrie -x 2.0 -y 0 -z 1.1 -R 0 -P 0 -Y 0
  6. verify messages are published to task topic: rostopic echo /srcsim/finals/task. If that doesn't happen, something is probably wrong in the init process. You'll need to stop the container and repeat from step 3
  7. press START on FC instance, this should trigger traffic shaper
  8. Launch VPN on OCU and test bandwidth to FC. e.g. iperf -s on OCU and iperf -c 192.168.2.150 on FC to test downlink bandwidth

values.description:
This PR extends our logging stuff to also mount .ros and .gazebo folders in the host machine and later upload the logs to S3. 

Besides uploading to S3 , the logs of each run world will be kept in the host instance at ~/code/simulator-logs/ folder.

This can be tested by creating a constellation using latest released AMIs, but before launching "
"World 1" (Run 1 button) you will need to change to branch `s3-ros-gazebo-logs` in the simulator instance.

Note: this PR also needs this change in widgets: #!/osrf/cloudsim-widgets/pull-requests/174/make-the-iso-timestamp-be-more-docker/diff
values.title: Also store gazebo and ROS logs in S3

Besides uploading to S3 , the logs of each run world will be kept in the host instance at ~/code/simulator-logs/ folder.

values.description:
Changes made to match the new [Task message fields](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/srcsim/src/7e12e7debaf46229baf397b398924167648e9a5e/msg/Task.msg?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) in the new release of srcsim 0.6.0.

Also started monitoring Score data.

Note this PR changes the JSON data that will be posted back to the portal.

~~~
{
  round_1: {
    tasks: [{
      current_checkpoint: 3,
      start_time: 0.0,
      elapsed_time: 0.0,
      timed_out: false,
      finished: false,
      checkpoint_durations: [0.0, 0.0],
      checkpoint_penalties: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]
      }, null, null]
    score: 0,
    total_completion_time: 0.0
  }
}

~~~

* `round` will now be suffixed with `_n` where `n` is from 1 to 5

* added `score`, and `total_completion_time` to `round_*` data 

* `tasks` is now an array. Note it can have null elements because competitors can skip tasks, e.g. `tasks:[null, {current_checkpoint: 0, etc}, null]`

* `checkpoints_completion` is now `checkpoint_durations`

* new `checkpoint_penalties` array in `tasks`
values.title: Update SRC monitor with new Task and Score data

Also started monitoring Score data.

Note this PR changes the JSON data that will be posted back to the portal.

* `round` will now be suffixed with `_n` where `n` is from 1 to 5

summary.html:
Changes made to match the new Task message fields in the new release of srcsim 0.6.0.

Also started monitoring Score data.

Note this PR changes the JSON data that will be posted back to the portal.

{
  round_1: {
    tasks: [{
      current_checkpoint: 3,
      start_time: 0.0,
      elapsed_time: 0.0,
      timed_out: false,
      finished: false,
      checkpoint_durations: [0.0, 0.0],
      checkpoint_penalties: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]
      }, null, null]
    score: 0,
    total_completion_time: 0.0
  }
}

  • round will now be suffixed with _n where n is from 1 to 5

  • added score, and total_completion_time to round_* data

  • tasks is now an array. Note it can have null elements because competitors can skip tasks, e.g. tasks:[null, {current_checkpoint: 0, etc}, null]

  • checkpoints_completion is now checkpoint_durations

  • new checkpoint_penalties array in tasks

values.description:
Workaround for https://bitbucket.org/osrf/srcsim/issues/218

This builds the team's docker image up to 5 times, sleeping more and more each time the build fails. Successfully built layers are in the docker cache, so rebuilding a teams image will only build the layer that failed onwards.

If the image fails to build cloudsim-sim is notified with `{"fc_docker_image:""}` and the script exits with return code 5. I assume cloudsim-sim and cloudsim-widgets will be modified in the future to display the failure to the user.
values.title: Retry building team's dockerfile in case it intermittently fails

summary.raw:
Workaround for https://bitbucket.org/osrf/srcsim/issues/218

This builds the team's docker image up to 5 times, sleeping more and more each time the build fails. Successfully built layers are in the docker cache, so rebuilding a teams image will only build the layer that failed onwards.

If the image fails to build cloudsim-sim is notified with `{"fc_docker_image:""}` and the script exits with return code 5. I assume cloudsim-sim and cloudsim-widgets will be modified in the future to display the failure to the user.
summary.html:
Workaround for https://bitbucket.org/osrf/srcsim/issues/218

This builds the team's docker image up to 5 times, sleeping more and more each time the build fails. Successfully built layers are in the docker cache, so rebuilding a teams image will only build the layer that failed onwards.

If the image fails to build cloudsim-sim is notified with {"fc_docker_image:""} and the script exits with return code 5. I assume cloudsim-sim and cloudsim-widgets will be modified in the future to display the failure to the user.

updated script to post back two more statuses:

{"harness_status": 0}

@german-mas another one to display in the new status box: harness_status

values.title: Timeout handler to stop_gazebo.bash script

values.description:
On the cloud, I've seen it happening when a bunch of `rosout` processes start being spawned and killed in an infinite loop like this:

~~~
process[rosout-1]: started with pid [22632]
[rosout-1] process has finished cleanly
log file: /home/cloudsim/.ros/log/0f5591c8-4b21-11e7-b55b-068ed08ab406/rosout-1*.log
~~~

Both times, this came accompanied of the SRCSim [Address already in use](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/srcsim/issues/181/ihmc-robotdatalogger-javanetbindexception) issue. 

@wjwwood said this might be due to multiple `roslaunch`es being launched at the same time and fighting over who gets to launch `roscore` goodies such as `rosout`. One solution would be to run `roscore` before and then run `roslaunch` with `--wait` so that it waits for `roscore` to be up and running. 

I haven't played with this on the cloud though, I suspect it might affect some CloudSim magic?
values.title: Launch a separate roscore before roslaunching

summary.raw:
On the cloud, I've seen it happening when a bunch of `rosout` processes start being spawned and killed in an infinite loop like this:

~~~
process[rosout-1]: started with pid [22632]
[rosout-1] process has finished cleanly
log file: /home/cloudsim/.ros/log/0f5591c8-4b21-11e7-b55b-068ed08ab406/rosout-1*.log
~~~

Both times, this came accompanied of the SRCSim [Address already in use](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/srcsim/issues/181/ihmc-robotdatalogger-javanetbindexception) issue. 

@wjwwood said this might be due to multiple `roslaunch`es being launched at the same time and fighting over who gets to launch `roscore` goodies such as `rosout`. One solution would be to run `roscore` before and then run `roslaunch` with `--wait` so that it waits for `roscore` to be up and running. 

I haven't played with this on the cloud though, I suspect it might affect some CloudSim magic?
summary.html:
On the cloud, I've seen it happening when a bunch of rosout processes start being spawned and killed in an infinite loop like this:

process[rosout-1]: started with pid [22632]
[rosout-1] process has finished cleanly
log file: /home/cloudsim/.ros/log/0f5591c8-4b21-11e7-b55b-068ed08ab406/rosout-1*.log

Both times, this came accompanied of the SRCSim Address already in use issue.

@wjwwood said this might be due to multiple roslaunches being launched at the same time and fighting over who gets to launch roscore goodies such as rosout. One solution would be to run roscore before and then run roslaunch with --wait so that it waits for roscore to be up and running.

I haven't played with this on the cloud though, I suspect it might affect some CloudSim magic?

values.description:
This PR changes instance startup script to mount to a s3 subfolder named after the srcsimulation-id. This is done to avoid downloading existing s3 files from the same bucket.

This PR depends on this other one from Portal : #!/osrf/cloudsim-portal/pull-requests/95/send-srcsimulation-id-to-instances/diff

values.description:
I remove this arg:

~~~
-v $codedir/simulator-logs/$WORLD_NAME/gazebo-server:/home/cloudsim/.gazebo
~~~

it seems to override the contents already available in `~/.gazebo`, .e.g `~/.gazebo/models`, which forces simulation to re-download models
values.title: remove .gazebo volume mapping

summary.raw:
I remove this arg:

~~~
-v $codedir/simulator-logs/$WORLD_NAME/gazebo-server:/home/cloudsim/.gazebo
~~~

it seems to override the contents already available in `~/.gazebo`, .e.g `~/.gazebo/models`, which forces simulation to re-download models
summary.html:
I remove this arg:

-v $codedir/simulator-logs/$WORLD_NAME/gazebo-server:/home/cloudsim/.gazebo

it seems to override the contents already available in ~/.gazebo, .e.g ~/.gazebo/models, which forces simulation to re-download models

values.description:
This PR depends on pull request #61

When simulator container goes down, e.g. a restart due to controller error, we need terminate the TC script and start it up again when the simulator is back up. We monitor the simulator by checking the ROS master.
values.title: Monitor ROS master from FC and restart TC as needed

summary.raw:
This PR depends on pull request #61

When simulator container goes down, e.g. a restart due to controller error, we need terminate the TC script and start it up again when the simulator is back up. We monitor the simulator by checking the ROS master.
summary.html:
This PR depends on pull request #61

When simulator container goes down, e.g. a restart due to controller error, we need terminate the TC script and start it up again when the simulator is back up. We monitor the simulator by checking the ROS master.

summary.html: And also post an event (before) to reset round score when src_monitor.py starts

values.title: Disable saving stderr stdout output to database

summary.html:
I'm not sure what frequency the state machine is running but upon checking the cloudsim-sim key in redis-server there are few hundred entries in the back-log and a giant never-ending state string containing outputs of the simulation process. Starting node gives a out of memory error. By default node is allowed to use 1.5GB of memory so the data we have already exceeds that amount.

This PR temporarily disables logging stderr / stdcout to database.

@preyna ptal

values.title: Report traffic parameters to the portal

values.description:
* fix deploy script

* comment out fs

* testing more tc changes

* update monitor script

* delay startup

* remove .gazebo volume mapping

* reduce harness check time

* fix uploading logs

* also remove cp commands

* disable output

values.title: Dry run branch to Default

values.description:
* Added fc_tc_parse.py to resolve mapping from team->round->world->tc values

* added hacky `/sim` route for FC to access team name and round number from Sim instance in order to utilize the fc_tc_parse.py. The sim instance posts to the `/sim` route that saves the data to `/tmp/sim_data`, and the FC instances curls the route to get that data

The TC mapping files are: `tcFile` and `teamRoundMappingFile`. They should be manually added to the `cloudsim-sim/src_commands` directory

Example `tcFile`:

~~~
World,T1 latency,T1 uplink,T1 downlink,T2_3 latency,T2_3 uplink,T2_3 downlink
1,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
2,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
3,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
4,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
5,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
~~~

example `teamRoundMappingFile`

~~~
Team,Round 1,Round 2,Round 3,Round 4,Round 5
SRC-debug,5,4,3,2,1
~~~
values.title: Read TC values from file

summary.raw:
* Added fc_tc_parse.py to resolve mapping from team->round->world->tc values

* added hacky `/sim` route for FC to access team name and round number from Sim instance in order to utilize the fc_tc_parse.py. The sim instance posts to the `/sim` route that saves the data to `/tmp/sim_data`, and the FC instances curls the route to get that data

The TC mapping files are: `tcFile` and `teamRoundMappingFile`. They should be manually added to the `cloudsim-sim/src_commands` directory

Example `tcFile`:

~~~
World,T1 latency,T1 uplink,T1 downlink,T2_3 latency,T2_3 uplink,T2_3 downlink
1,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
2,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
3,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
4,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
5,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
~~~

example `teamRoundMappingFile`

~~~
Team,Round 1,Round 2,Round 3,Round 4,Round 5
SRC-debug,5,4,3,2,1
~~~
summary.html:
• Added fc_tc_parse.py to resolve mapping from team->round->world->tc values

  • added hacky /sim route for FC to access team name and round number from Sim instance in order to utilize the fc_tc_parse.py. The sim instance posts to the /sim route that saves the data to /tmp/sim_data, and the FC instances curls the route to get that data

The TC mapping files are: tcFile and teamRoundMappingFile. They should be manually added to the cloudsim-sim/src_commands directory

Example tcFile:

World,T1 latency,T1 uplink,T1 downlink,T2_3 latency,T2_3 uplink,T2_3 downlink
1,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
2,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
3,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
4,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit
5,100ms,2mbit,3mbit,100ms,1mbit,4mbit

example teamRoundMappingFile

Team,Round 1,Round 2,Round 3,Round 4,Round 5
SRC-debug,5,4,3,2,1

values.description: We experienced problem getting Task messages if the TC script is started too early so this PR adds a  check to make sure the `/srcsim/finals/task` topic exists before starting the script
values.title: Check for task topic before starting tc script

summary.raw: We experienced problem getting Task messages if the TC script is started too early so this PR adds a  check to make sure the `/srcsim/finals/task` topic exists before starting the script
